titleInfo.title: Letter No. 46: Andrew Ramsay, Thomas Day, John Torlesse, William Hornby, Daniel Draper, Nathaniel Stackhouse and William Ashburner, Council at Bombay Castle, to Edward Galley, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: This letter, received 6 February 1781, notes the receipt of John Beaumont's letters by the Eagle, Rangerand Yarmouth. The letter discusses the woollens conveyed on the Mercuryand the Morning Star. Included is an extract (no. 47) from the Company's commands, dated 12 April 1780, appointing Daniel Draper as Governor of Bombay in the event of the death, removal or resignation of Governor William Hornby.
